Package eportfolio

Class MutualFund

java.lang.Object
eportfolio.MutualFund
public class MutualFund extends Object
This class is used for the mutual fund data, containing mutual fund information for symbol, name, quantity, price, and bookvalue

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MutualFund()
    This constructor is the default constructor and does not initialize any data for the mutual fund
    MutualFund(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue)
    This constructor accepts data for the symbol, name quantity, price and book value of a mutual fund and sets these to the Mutual Fund object's symbol, name quantity, price and book value

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    buy(int addedQuantity, double newPrice)
    This method performs a mutual fund buy, adding the quantity bought to the previous quantity of the mutual fund, updating price at the time of purchase, and calculates the bookvalue for the mutual with no fee, adding it to the previous bookValue
    boolean
    equals(MutualFund mutualFund)
    Checks if two mutual funds are equal in terms of all attributes
    double
    getBookValue()
    This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's book value
    double
    getGain(int sellQuantity, double salePrice)
    This method calculates the theoretical gain of a mutual fund (as if it were a full sale) and returns it to be printed in main (sale fee of 45.00 included)
    String
    getName()
    This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's name
    double
    getPrice()
    This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's price
    int
    getQuantity()
    This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's quanity
    String
    getSymbol()
    This method will return the current value of the mutual fund's symbol
    double
    sell(int sellQuantity, double salePrice, ArrayList<MutualFund> inputList, int i)
    This method performs a mutual fund sell, either partial or full if the quanitity parameter is not larger than the quantity of mutual fund owned FULL SALE: sets quantity and bookValue to zero and removes mutual fund PARTIAL SALE: sets remaining quanitity after sale, updates price to the price at which mutual fund was sold, and calculates the book value of the mutual fund remaining
    void
    setBookValue(double bookValue)
    This method will set the current of value of the bookValue to the double value passed in

    This method will set the current of value of the name to the string value passed in

    This method will set the current of value of the quantity to the int value passed in
    void
    setSymbol(String symbol)
    This method will set the current of value of the symbol to the string value passed in
    String
    toString()

    • MutualFund

      public MutualFund()
      This constructor is the default constructor and does not initialize any data for the mutual fund

    • MutualFund

      public MutualFund(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue)
      This constructor accepts data for the symbol, name quantity, price and book value of a mutual fund and sets these to the Mutual Fund object's symbol, name quantity, price and book value
      Parameters:
      symbol - - string value for the symbol
      name - - string value for the name
      quantity - - int value for the quantity
      price - - double value for the price
      bookValue - - double for the book value

    • buy

      public double buy(int addedQuantity, double newPrice)
      This method performs a mutual fund buy, adding the quantity bought to the previous quantity of the mutual fund, updating price at the time of purchase, and calculates the bookvalue for the mutual with no fee, adding it to the previous bookValue
      Parameters:
      addedQuantity - - the quantity of stock bought
      newPrice - - the price at which stock was bought
      Returns:
      the bookvalue of the purchase (no fee)

    • sell

      public double sell(int sellQuantity, double salePrice, ArrayList<MutualFund> inputList, int i)
      This method performs a mutual fund sell, either partial or full if the quanitity parameter is not larger than the quantity of mutual fund owned FULL SALE: sets quantity and bookValue to zero and removes mutual fund PARTIAL SALE: sets remaining quanitity after sale, updates price to the price at which mutual fund was sold, and calculates the book value of the mutual fund remaining
      Parameters:
      sellQuantity - - the quantity of stock bought
      salePrice - - the price at which stock was bought
      inputList - - for removal of stock at full sale
      i - - index of arrayList of stocks to remove at full sale
      Returns:
      the gain of the partial or full sale of the mutual fund

    • getGain

      public double getGain(int sellQuantity, double salePrice)
      This method calculates the theoretical gain of a mutual fund (as if it were a full sale) and returns it to be printed in main (sale fee of 45.00 included)
      Parameters:
      sellQuantity - - the theoretical quantity being sold
      salePrice - - the theoretical sale price
      Returns:
      theoretical gain of the mutual fund

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Displays all information of the stock neatly
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      all information of the stock

    • equals

      public boolean equals(MutualFund mutualFund)
      Checks if two mutual funds are equal in terms of all attributes
      Parameters:
      mutualFund - is the other mutual fund in the comparison (fund1.equals(fund2))
      Returns:
      true or falls depending if equal or not
